causality.effect: End of Acquisition phase and start of Conversion phase.

causality.trigger: Completion of the t_CONV period for all devices in the chain.
causality.effect: The SDO line of each device is driven high, indicating the bus is ready for data readback.
A new data bit is shifted out on each SDO pin.
The data present on the SDI pin is sampled and shifted into the internal register.
End of the Data Readback phase and start of a new Acquisition phase.
causality.condition: After all data bits have been clocked out.

constraints.t_HSCKCNV: SCK Hold Time after CNV Rising Edge
constraints.t_SSCKCNV: SCK Setup Time before CNV Rising Edge
constraints.t_EN: SDO Enable Time (from end of conversion to SDO driven high)
constraints.t_SSDISCK: SDI Setup Time before SCK Falling Edge
constraints.t_HSDISC: SDI Hold Time after SCK Falling Edge
constraints.t_HSDO: SDO Data Hold Time (after SCK falling edge)
constraints.t_DSDOSDI: SDO to SDO Propagation Delay through a device in the chain

states.description: Device is acquiring the analog input signal. CNV is low.
Device is converting the acquired analog signal to a digital value. This phase is initiated by a rising edge on CNV, and CNV is held high.
After conversion completes, SDO goes high as a busy indicator. Digital data is shifted out on the falling edges of SCK.
During the Acquisition and Conversion phases, the SDO pin is in a high-impedance state until time t_EN after the conversion is complete.
